# healthyR.ts

> **The Time Series Modeling Companion to healthyR**

To view the full wiki, click here: [Full healthyR.ts
Wiki](https://github.com/spsanderson/healthyR.ts/blob/master/wiki/Home.md)

`healthyR.ts` is a comprehensive R package designed specifically for
time series analysis and forecasting of hospital administrative and
clinical data. Built on the powerful
[tidymodels](https://www.tidymodels.org/) ecosystem, it provides a
consistent, user-friendly framework that simplifies complex time series
workflows.

## Why healthyR.ts?

Hospital data analysis often requires handling time series for metrics
like: - Average Length of Stay (ALOS) - Readmission rates - Patient
volumes and admissions - Bed occupancy rates - Clinical outcomes over
time

`healthyR.ts` takes the guesswork out of time series analysis by
providing:

‚úÖ **Automated Workflows** - One-function solutions for complete
modeling pipelines  
‚úÖ **Visual Analytics** - Rich plotting functions for data exploration  
‚úÖ **Data Generators** - Simulate realistic time series for testing and
validation  
‚úÖ **Statistical Tools** - Comprehensive suite of time series
statistics  
‚úÖ **Clustering** - Feature-based time series clustering capabilities  
‚úÖ **Forecasting** - 15 automated model workflows (ARIMA, Prophet,
XGBoost, and more)

## Key Features

### ü§ñ Automatic Modeling Workflows

Complete end-to-end modeling pipelines in a single function call:

- **ts_auto_arima()** - Automatic ARIMA modeling
- **ts_auto_prophet_reg()** - Facebook‚Äôs Prophet algorithm
- **ts_auto_xgboost()** - Gradient boosting for time series
- **ts_auto_nnetar()** - Neural network autoregression
- Plus 11 more specialized workflows!

Each function handles recipe creation, model specification, workflow
setup, model fitting, tuning, and calibration automatically.

### üìä Visualization Suite

- Calendar heatmaps for temporal patterns
- Time series clustering plots
- Velocity, acceleration, and growth visualizations
- QQ plots and scedasticity analysis
- Moving average and SMA plots
- Event analysis visualizations

### üé≤ Data Generation

Generate synthetic time series data for testing: - Random walks and
Brownian motion - Geometric Brownian motion - ARIMA simulations - Custom
parameter configurations

### üìà Statistical Analysis

- ADF stationarity tests
- Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) analysis
- Confidence intervals
- Lag correlation analysis
- Time series feature extraction

## Installation

### Stable Release (CRAN)

Install the latest stable version from
[CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org):

``` r
install.packages("healthyR.ts")
```

### Development Version

Get the latest features and bug fixes from
[GitHub](https://github.com/spsanderson/healthyR.ts):

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("spsanderson/healthyR.ts")
```

## Quick Start

### Basic Example: Random Walk Simulation

Generate and visualize random walk data to understand market volatility
or patient flow variations:

``` r
library(healthyR.ts)
library(ggplot2)

df <- ts_random_walk()

head(df)
#> # A tibble: 6 √ó 4
#>     run     x        y cum_y
#>   <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1     1 -0.00559  994.
#> 2     1     2  0.119   1112.
#> 3     1     3  0.109   1233.
#> 4     1     4  0.0255  1265.
#> 5     1     5 -0.0320  1224.
#> 6     1     6 -0.0397  1176.
```

Now that the data has been generated, lets take a look at it.

``` r
df %>%
   ggplot(
       mapping = aes(
           x = x
           , y = cum_y
           , color = factor(run)
           , group = factor(run)
        )
    ) +
    geom_line(alpha = 0.8) +
    ts_random_walk_ggplot_layers(df)
```

![](reference/figures/README-ts_random_walk_ggplot_layers-1.png)

That is still pretty noisy, so lets see this in a different way. Lets
clear this up a bit to make it easier to see the full range of the
possible volatility of the random walks.

``` r
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

df %>%
    group_by(x) %>%
    summarise(
        min_y = min(cum_y),
        max_y = max(cum_y)
    ) %>%
    ggplot(
        aes(x = x)
    ) +
    geom_line(aes(y = max_y), color = "steelblue") +
    geom_line(aes(y = min_y), color = "firebrick") +
    geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = min_y, ymax = max_y), alpha = 0.2) +
    ts_random_walk_ggplot_layers(df)
```

![](reference/figures/README-unnamed-chunk-2-1.png)

### Calendar Heatmap Visualization

Visualize temporal patterns in your data with calendar heatmaps -
perfect for identifying seasonal trends or unusual patterns in hospital
metrics:

``` r
data_tbl <- data.frame(
  date_col = seq.Date(
    from = as.Date("2020-01-01"),
    to   = as.Date("2022-06-01"),
    length.out = 365*2 + 180
    ),
  value = rnorm(365*2+180, mean = 100)
)

ts_calendar_heatmap_plot(
  .data          = data_tbl
  , .date_col    = date_col
  , .value_col   = value
  , .interactive = FALSE
)
```

![](reference/figures/README-unnamed-chunk-3-1.png)

### Time Series Clustering

Discover patterns by clustering time series based on their statistical
features:

``` r
data_tbl <- ts_to_tbl(AirPassengers) %>%
  mutate(group_id = rep(1:12, 12))

output <- ts_feature_cluster(
  .data = data_tbl,
  .date_col = date_col,
  .value_col = value,
  group_id,
  .features = c("acf_features","entropy"),
  .scale = TRUE,
  .prefix = "ts_",
  .centers = 3
)

ts_feature_cluster_plot(
  .data = output,
  .date_col = date_col,
  .value_col = value,
  .center = 2,
  group_id
)
```

![](reference/figures/README-unnamed-chunk-4-1.png)

``` R
#> $plot
#> $plot$static_plot
```

![](reference/figures/README-unnamed-chunk-4-2.png)

``` R
#> 
#> $plot$plotly_plot
#> 
#> 
#> $data
#> $data$original_data
#> # A tibble: 144 √ó 4
#>    index     date_col   value group_id
#>    <yearmon> <date>     <dbl>    <int>
#>  1 Jan 1949  1949-01-01   112        1
#>  2 Feb 1949  1949-02-01   118        2
#>  3 Mar 1949  1949-03-01   132        3
#>  4 Apr 1949  1949-04-01   129        4
#>  5 May 1949  1949-05-01   121        5
#>  6 Jun 1949  1949-06-01   135        6
#>  7 Jul 1949  1949-07-01   148        7
#>  8 Aug 1949  1949-08-01   148        8
#>  9 Sep 1949  1949-09-01   136        9
#> 10 Oct 1949  1949-10-01   119       10
#> # ‚Ñπ 134 more rows
#> 
#> $data$kmm_data_tbl
#> # A tibble: 3 √ó 3
#>   centers k_means  glance          
#>     <int> <list>   <list>          
#> 1       1 <kmeans> <tibble [1 √ó 4]>
#> 2       2 <kmeans> <tibble [1 √ó 4]>
#> 3       3 <kmeans> <tibble [1 √ó 4]>
#> 
#> $data$user_item_tbl
#> # A tibble: 12 √ó 8
#>    group_id ts_x_acf1 ts_x_acf10 ts_diff1_acf1 ts_diff1_acf10 ts_diff2_acf1
#>       <int>     <dbl>      <dbl>         <dbl>          <dbl>         <dbl>
#>  1        1     0.741       1.55       -0.0995          0.474       -0.182 
#>  2        2     0.730       1.50       -0.0155          0.654       -0.147 
#>  3        3     0.766       1.62       -0.471           0.562       -0.620 
#>  4        4     0.715       1.46       -0.253           0.457       -0.555 
#>  5        5     0.730       1.48       -0.372           0.417       -0.649 
#>  6        6     0.751       1.61        0.122           0.646        0.0506
#>  7        7     0.745       1.58        0.260           0.236       -0.303 
#>  8        8     0.761       1.60        0.319           0.419       -0.319 
#>  9        9     0.747       1.59       -0.235           0.191       -0.650 
#> 10       10     0.732       1.50       -0.0371          0.269       -0.510 
#> 11       11     0.746       1.54       -0.310           0.357       -0.556 
#> 12       12     0.735       1.51       -0.360           0.294       -0.601 
#> # ‚Ñπ 2 more variables: ts_seas_acf1 <dbl>, ts_entropy <dbl>
#> 
#> $data$cluster_tbl
#> # A tibble: 12 √ó 9
#>    cluster group_id ts_x_acf1 ts_x_acf10 ts_diff1_acf1 ts_diff1_acf10
#>      <int>    <int>     <dbl>      <dbl>         <dbl>          <dbl>
#>  1       1        1     0.741       1.55       -0.0995          0.474
#>  2       1        2     0.730       1.50       -0.0155          0.654
#>  3       2        3     0.766       1.62       -0.471           0.562
#>  4       2        4     0.715       1.46       -0.253           0.457
#>  5       2        5     0.730       1.48       -0.372           0.417
#>  6       1        6     0.751       1.61        0.122           0.646
#>  7       1        7     0.745       1.58        0.260           0.236
#>  8       1        8     0.761       1.60        0.319           0.419
#>  9       2        9     0.747       1.59       -0.235           0.191
#> 10       2       10     0.732       1.50       -0.0371          0.269
#> 11       2       11     0.746       1.54       -0.310           0.357
#> 12       2       12     0.735       1.51       -0.360           0.294
#> # ‚Ñπ 3 more variables: ts_diff2_acf1 <dbl>, ts_seas_acf1 <dbl>, ts_entropy <dbl>
#> 
#> 
#> $kmeans_object
#> $kmeans_object[[1]]
#> K-means clustering with 2 clusters of sizes 5, 7
#> 
#> Cluster means:
#>   ts_x_acf1 ts_x_acf10 ts_diff1_acf1 ts_diff1_acf10 ts_diff2_acf1 ts_seas_acf1
#> 1 0.7456468   1.568532     0.1172685      0.4858013    -0.1799728    0.2876449
#> 2 0.7387865   1.528308    -0.2909349      0.3638392    -0.5916245    0.2930543
#>   ts_entropy
#> 1  0.4918321
#> 2  0.6438176
#> 
#> Clustering vector:
#>  [1] 1 1 2 2 2 1 1 1 2 2 2 2
#> 
#> Within cluster sum of squares by cluster:
#> [1] 0.3704304 0.3660630
#>  (between_SS / total_SS =  59.8 %)
#> 
#> Available components:
#> 
#> [1] "cluster"      "centers"      "totss"        "withinss"     "tot.withinss"
#> [6] "betweenss"    "size"         "iter"         "ifault"
```

### Event Analysis

Analyze time series behavior before and after significant events (e.g.,
policy changes, new treatments):

``` r
library(dplyr)
df <- ts_to_tbl(AirPassengers) %>% select(-index)

ts_time_event_analysis_tbl(
  .data = df,
  .horizon = 6,
  .date_col = date_col,
  .value_col = value,
  .direction = "both"
) %>%
  ts_event_analysis_plot()
```

![](reference/figures/README-unnamed-chunk-5-1.png)

``` r


ts_time_event_analysis_tbl(
  .data = df,
  .horizon = 6,
  .date_col = date_col,
  .value_col = value,
  .direction = "both"
) %>%
  ts_event_analysis_plot(.plot_type = "individual")
```

![](reference/figures/README-unnamed-chunk-5-2.png)

### ARIMA Simulation

Generate realistic ARIMA time series for testing and validation:

``` r
output <- ts_arima_simulator()
output$plots$static_plot
```

![](reference/figures/README-unnamed-chunk-6-1.png)

## Available Models

### Automated Workflow Functions

Each function creates a complete modeling pipeline including recipe,
model specification, workflow, fitting, and calibration:

| Function | Model Type | Description |
|----|----|----|
| [`ts_auto_arima()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_arima.md) | ARIMA | Automatic ARIMA with auto-tuning |
| [`ts_auto_arima_xgboost()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_arima_xgboost.md) | Hybrid | ARIMA errors with XGBoost |
| [`ts_auto_prophet_reg()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_prophet_reg.md) | Prophet | Facebook‚Äôs Prophet algorithm |
| [`ts_auto_prophet_boost()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_prophet_boost.md) | Hybrid | Prophet with XGBoost |
| [`ts_auto_xgboost()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_xgboost.md) | ML | Gradient boosting |
| [`ts_auto_nnetar()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_nnetar.md) | Neural Net | Neural network autoregression |
| [`ts_auto_exp_smoothing()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_exp_smoothing.md) | ETS | Exponential smoothing |
| [`ts_auto_smooth_es()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_smooth_es.md) | Smooth | Smooth package ETS |
| [`ts_auto_theta()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_theta.md) | Theta | Theta method |
| [`ts_auto_croston()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_croston.md) | Croston | For intermittent demand |
| [`ts_auto_lm()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_lm.md) | Linear | Linear regression with time features |
| [`ts_auto_mars()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_mars.md) | MARS | Multivariate adaptive regression splines |
| [`ts_auto_glmnet()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_glmnet.md) | GLM | Elastic net regression |
| [`ts_auto_svm_poly()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_svm_poly.md) | SVM | Support vector machine (polynomial) |
| [`ts_auto_svm_rbf()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_svm_rbf.md) | SVM | Support vector machine (radial) |

## Function Categories

`healthyR.ts` includes 90+ functions organized into these categories:

- **üìä Data Generators**: Create synthetic time series data (random
  walks, Brownian motion, ARIMA)
- **üìà Plotting Functions**: Comprehensive visualization suite for time
  series
- **üîç Clustering**: Feature-based time series clustering and analysis
- **ü§ñ Forecasting**: Automated modeling workflows and model comparison
- **üìê Statistical Functions**: Tests, transformations, and time series
  statistics
- **üîß Utilities**: Helper functions for data manipulation and
  transformation
- **üìâ Augment Functions**: Add features like velocity, acceleration,
  and growth rates
- **üßÆ Vector Functions**: Vectorized operations for time series
- **üî¨ Recipe Steps**: Custom tidymodels recipe steps for time series

  Full documentation site

## Learning Resources

### Vignettes

- [Getting Started with
  healthyR.ts](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/articles/getting-started.html)
- [Using Tidy
  FFT](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/articles/using-tidy-fft.html)

### Example Use Cases

1.  **Hospital Admissions Forecasting** - Predict daily/weekly
    admissions using multiple models
2.  **Length of Stay Analysis** - Analyze and forecast ALOS trends
3.  **Readmission Rate Monitoring** - Track and predict readmission
    patterns
4.  **Resource Planning** - Forecast bed occupancy and staffing needs
5.  **Seasonal Pattern Detection** - Identify and visualize seasonal
    trends in clinical data

Contributions are welcome! Here‚Äôs how you can help:

- üêõ **Report bugs** via [GitHub
  Issues](https://github.com/spsanderson/healthyR.ts/issues)
- üí° **Suggest features** through issue requests
- üîß **Submit pull requests** for bug fixes or new features
- üìñ **Improve documentation** by suggesting clarifications or additions

Please follow the [tidyverse style guide](https://style.tidyverse.org/)
for code contributions.

- [**healthyR**](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR/) - Hospital data
  analysis companion package
- [**healthyR.ai**](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ai/) - Machine
  learning companion for healthcare
- [**healthyverse**](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyverse/) -
  Meta-package loading all healthyR packages

``` r
citation("healthyR.ts")
```

# Package index

## Data Generating Functions

healthyR.ts functions that generate data

- [`tidy_fft()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/tidy_fft.md)
  : Tidy Style FFT
- [`ts_brownian_motion()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_brownian_motion.md)
  : Brownian Motion
- [`ts_brownian_motion_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_brownian_motion_augment.md)
  : Brownian Motion
- [`ts_geometric_brownian_motion()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_geometric_brownian_motion.md)
  : Geometric Brownian Motion
- [`ts_geometric_brownian_motion_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_geometric_brownian_motion_augment.md)
  : Geometric Brownian Motion
- [`ts_random_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_random_walk.md)
  : Random Walk Function

## Plotting Functions

healthyR.ts plotting functions

- [`ts_random_walk_ggplot_layers()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_random_walk_ggplot_layers.md)
  :

  Get Random Walk `ggplot2` layers

- [`ts_qc_run_chart()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_qc_run_chart.md)
  : Quality Control Run Chart

- [`ts_ma_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_ma_plot.md)
  : Time Series Moving Average Plot

- [`ts_sma_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_sma_plot.md)
  : Simple Moving Average Plot

- [`ts_calendar_heatmap_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_calendar_heatmap_plot.md)
  : Time Series Calendar Heatmap

- [`ts_splits_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_splits_plot.md)
  : Time Series Splits Plot

- [`ts_vva_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_vva_plot.md)
  : Time Series Value, Velocity and Acceleration Plot

- [`ts_qq_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_qq_plot.md)
  : Time Series Model QQ Plot

- [`ts_scedacity_scatter_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_scedacity_scatter_plot.md)
  : Time Series Model Scedacity Plot

- [`color_blind()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/color_blind.md)
  : Provide Colorblind Compliant Colors

- [`ts_scale_color_colorblind()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_scale_color_colorblind.md)
  : Provide Colorblind Compliant Colors

- [`ts_scale_fill_colorblind()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_scale_fill_colorblind.md)
  : Provide Colorblind Compliant Colors

- [`ts_brownian_motion_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_brownian_motion_plot.md)
  : Auto-Plot a Geometric/Brownian Motion Augment

- [`ts_event_analysis_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_event_analysis_plot.md)
  : Time Series Event Analysis Plot

## Time Series Clustering

Time Series Clustering Functions

- [`ts_feature_cluster()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_feature_cluster.md)
  : Time Series Feature Clustering
- [`ts_feature_cluster_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_feature_cluster_plot.md)
  : Time Series Feature Clustering

## Time Filtering Functions

healthyR.ts time based filtering functions

- [`ts_compare_data()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_compare_data.md)
  : Compare data over time periods
- [`ts_time_event_analysis_tbl()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_time_event_analysis_tbl.md)
  : Event Analysis

## Time Series Forecasting and Simulation

healthyR.ts time series forecasting and simulation functions

- [`ts_arima_simulator()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_arima_simulator.md)
  : Simulate ARIMA Model
- [`ts_forecast_simulator()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_forecast_simulator.md)
  : Time-series Forecasting Simulator

## Time Series Recipes

healthyR.ts automatic time series recipe functions

- [`ts_auto_recipe()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_recipe.md)
  : Build a Time Series Recipe

## Time Series Auto Workflowsets

healthyR.ts automatic time series workflow set functions

- [`ts_wfs_arima_boost()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_wfs_arima_boost.md)
  : Auto Arima XGBoost Workflowset Function
- [`ts_wfs_auto_arima()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_wfs_auto_arima.md)
  : Auto Arima (Forecast auto_arima) Workflowset Function
- [`ts_wfs_ets_reg()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_wfs_ets_reg.md)
  : Auto ETS Workflowset Function
- [`ts_wfs_lin_reg()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_wfs_lin_reg.md)
  : Auto Linear Regression Workflowset Function
- [`ts_wfs_mars()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_wfs_mars.md)
  : Auto MARS (Earth) Workflowset Function
- [`ts_wfs_nnetar_reg()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_wfs_nnetar_reg.md)
  : Auto NNETAR Workflowset Function
- [`ts_wfs_prophet_reg()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_wfs_prophet_reg.md)
  : Auto PROPHET Regression Workflowset Function
- [`ts_wfs_svm_poly()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_wfs_svm_poly.md)
  : Auto SVM Poly (Kernlab) Workflowset Function
- [`ts_wfs_svm_rbf()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_wfs_svm_rbf.md)
  : Auto SVM RBF (Kernlab) Workflowset Function
- [`ts_wfs_xgboost()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_wfs_xgboost.md)
  : Auto XGBoost (XGBoost) Workflowset Function

## Time Series Boiler Plate Functions

healthyR.ts automatic time series functions to create in a single call a
Recipe, Model Specification, Workflow, Model Fit, Tuned Model and
Calibration object.

### Auto Workflows

- [`ts_auto_arima()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_arima.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_arima_xgboost()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_arima_xgboost.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_croston()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_croston.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_exp_smoothing()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_exp_smoothing.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_glmnet()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_glmnet.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_lm()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_lm.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_mars()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_mars.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_nnetar()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_nnetar.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_prophet_boost()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_prophet_boost.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_prophet_reg()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_prophet_reg.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_smooth_es()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_smooth_es.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_svm_poly()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_svm_poly.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_svm_rbf()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_svm_rbf.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_theta()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_theta.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow
- [`ts_auto_xgboost()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_auto_xgboost.md)
  : Boilerplate Workflow

## Time Series Vector Functions

healthyR.ts vectorized Functions

- [`ts_acceleration_vec()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_acceleration_vec.md)
  : Vector Function Time Series Acceleration
- [`ts_growth_rate_vec()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_growth_rate_vec.md)
  : Vector Function Time Series Growth Rate
- [`ts_velocity_vec()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_velocity_vec.md)
  : Vector Function Time Series Acceleration

## Time Series Augment Functions

healthyR.ts augmenting Functions

- [`ts_acceleration_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_acceleration_augment.md)
  : Augment Function Acceleration
- [`ts_brownian_motion_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_brownian_motion_augment.md)
  : Brownian Motion
- [`ts_geometric_brownian_motion_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_geometric_brownian_motion_augment.md)
  : Geometric Brownian Motion
- [`ts_growth_rate_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_growth_rate_augment.md)
  : Augment Data with Time Series Growth Rates
- [`ts_velocity_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_velocity_augment.md)
  : Augment Function Velocity

## Time Series Recipe Step Functions

healthyR.ts step functions

- [`step_ts_acceleration()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/step_ts_acceleration.md)
  : Recipes Time Series Acceleration Generator
- [`step_ts_velocity()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/step_ts_velocity.md)
  : Recipes Time Series velocity Generator

## Time Series Helper Functions

healthyR.ts helper Functions

- [`auto_stationarize()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/auto_stationarize.md)
  : Automatically Stationarize Time Series Data
- [`calibrate_and_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/calibrate_and_plot.md)
  : Helper function - Calibrate and Plot
- [`internal_ts_backward_event_tbl()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/internal_ts_backward_event_tbl.md)
  : Event Analysis
- [`internal_ts_both_event_tbl()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/internal_ts_both_event_tbl.md)
  : Event Analysis
- [`internal_ts_forward_event_tbl()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/internal_ts_forward_event_tbl.md)
  : Event Analysis
- [`model_extraction_helper()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/model_extraction_helper.md)
  : Model Method Extraction Helper
- [`ts_get_date_columns()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_get_date_columns.md)
  : Get date or datetime variables (column names)
- [`ts_info_tbl()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_info_tbl.md)
  : Get Time Series Information
- [`ts_is_date_class()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_is_date_class.md)
  : Check if an object is a date class
- [`ts_lag_correlation()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_lag_correlation.md)
  : Time Series Lag Correlation Analysis
- [`ts_model_auto_tune()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_model_auto_tune.md)
  : Time Series Model Tuner
- [`ts_model_compare()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_model_compare.md)
  : Compare Two Time Series Models
- [`ts_model_rank_tbl()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_model_rank_tbl.md)
  : Model Rank
- [`ts_model_spec_tune_template()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_model_spec_tune_template.md)
  : Time Series Model Spec Template
- [`ts_qq_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_qq_plot.md)
  : Time Series Model QQ Plot
- [`ts_scedacity_scatter_plot()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_scedacity_scatter_plot.md)
  : Time Series Model Scedacity Plot
- [`ts_to_tbl()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_to_tbl.md)
  : Coerce a time-series object to a tibble
- [`util_difflog_ts()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/util_difflog_ts.md)
  : Differencing with Log Transformation to Make Time Series Stationary
- [`util_doubledifflog_ts()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/util_doubledifflog_ts.md)
  : Double Differencing with Log Transformation to Make Time Series
  Stationary
- [`util_doublediff_ts()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/util_doublediff_ts.md)
  : Double Differencing to Make Time Series Stationary
- [`util_log_ts()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/util_log_ts.md)
  : Logarithmic Transformation to Make Time Series Stationary
- [`util_singlediff_ts()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/util_singlediff_ts.md)
  : Single Differencing to Make Time Series Stationary

## Statistic Functions

healthyR.ts simple and complex statistical functions

- [`ci_hi()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ci_hi.md)
  : Confidence Interval Generic
- [`ci_lo()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ci_lo.md)
  : Confidence Interval Generic
- [`ts_adf_test()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/healthyR.ts/reference/ts_adf_test.md)
  : Augmented Dickey-Fuller Test for Time Series Stationarity
